item.title: RESTful APIs: Principles, Practices, and Examples
item.description: Introduction RESTful APIs have become the backbone of web services and applications, providing a standard and efficient way for systems to communicate over the internet. This article delves into the principles of REST, its advantages, and practical examples to illustrate best practices in designing and consuming RESTful APIs. Understanding RESTful APIs REST (Representational State Transfer) is an architectural style that defines a set of constraints for creating web services. RESTful APIs enable interactions between client and server through a set of stateless operations, primarily using HTTP methods such as GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE.
